funder.name: Natural Science Foundation of Shandong Province

abstract: <jats:p>The<jats:italic>Antispila</jats:italic>species feeding on Vitaceae from Shandong Peninsula, China are treated.<jats:italic>Antispilakunyuensis</jats:italic>Liu,<jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, feeding on<jats:italic>Ampelopsishumulifolia</jats:italic>, is described as new to science, and<jats:italic>A.uenoi</jats:italic>Kuroko, 1987, feeding on<jats:italic>Vitisamurensis</jats:italic>, is recorded as new for China.<jats:italic>Vitisamurensis</jats:italic>is documented as a new host plant for<jats:italic>A.uenoi</jats:italic>. The adult male and female, host plant and typical patterns of leaf-mines of both species are illustrated, as are male and female genitalia and venation. The venation and the paired tufts of scales on the 7<jats:sup>th</jats:sup>abdominal segment in male are illustrated for<jats:italic>A.uenoi</jats:italic>for the first time. DNA barcodes of both species are also provided, together with a neighbor-joining tree for facilitating species delimitation.</jats:p>
title: The leaf-mining genus Antispila Hübner, 1825 feeding on Vitaceae in Shandong Peninsula, China with one new species (Lepidoptera, Heliozelidae)

reference.author: Cheng
reference.journal-title: Sedimentary Geology of the Yellow River Delta.
